job.title: Business Analyst
job.description:
Tevpro is a boutique custom software development firm in Houston, TX. We seek a Business Analyst to join our highly technical team of developers and consultants.

The Business Analyst will be integral to our software development team to lead clients through complex software implementations and custom development projects. The role will work closely with product owners, software developers, UI/UX designers, and solution architects to help drive the development of the applications from inception to release.

The successful Business Analyst will have prior experience reviewing and writing use-case documentation for software systems in an agile software development environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Gather detailed client requirements and documents for software/user stories in GitHub, GitLab, Jira, Asana (or preferred project management software).
  • Create clarity around business objectives through the development and refinement of user stories.
  • Estimate project deliverables, develop project plans, write development stories, and coordinate sprint planning and scrum activities to deliver successful projects on time and within budget.
  • Manage daily standups, sprints, demos, backlog grooming, and retrospective meetings to identify process improvements. 
  • Regularly communicate with senior management regarding the status of specific project deliverables, and interact with clients to set and manage expectations.

QUALIFICATIONS 

  • 2+ years of Business Analyst or Project Management experience working within large, multi-team engagements.
  • 2+ years of experience in software development, quality assurance, and/or technical support.
  • Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 
  • Excellent communication, insatiable curiosity, and exceptional attention to detail.
  • Strong knowledge of Scrum theory, rules, and practices.
  • Must have hands-on experience with proposal creation and leading proposal presentations.
  • Knowledge of Agile techniques like User Stories, Continuous Integration, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Testing, Pairing, and Automated Testing.
  • Flexibility to travel.

EDUCATION 

Technical background with a bachelor's degree in IT or Computer Software is required. A minimum GPA of 3.5 is required.  

COMPENSATION

  • Competitive salary + Bonus
  • Training and Education Allowance
  • Remote, in-office, or Hybrid work
  • PTO + Holidays
  • Matching 401k
  • Health benefits – Medical, Dental & Vision

LOCATION

Our offices are headquartered in Houston, TX. 

We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time. Candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

job.title: Software Development Project Manager
job.description:
Tevpro seeks an experienced Software Development Project Manager to join its rapidly growing firm in Houston, TX.

The Project Manager will work as an integral part of our custom software development team to lead clients through complex software implementations and custom development projects. The role will work closely with product owners, software developers, UI/UX designers, and solution architects to help drive the development of the applications from inception to release.

RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Gather, record, and translate detailed business requirements into user stories for either agile or waterfall projects.
  • Develop and manage project schedules, budgets, allocation of resources, documentation, change requests, risks, and issues to ensure the maximum business benefit is maintained.
  • Estimate project deliverables, develop project plans, write development stories, and coordinate sprint planning and scrum activities to deliver successful projects on time and within budget.
  • Manage daily standups, sprints, demos, backlog grooming, and retrospective meetings to identify process improvements. 
  • Regularly communicate with senior management regarding the status of specific project deliverables, and interact with clients to set and manage expectations.
  • Create clarity around business objectives through the development and refinement of user stories.
  • Work with the Sales and business development team to create statements of work, proposals, and project quotes. 

QUALIFICATIONS 

  • 3+ years of Business Analyst or Project Management experience working within large, multi-team engagements.
  • 2+ years of experience in software development, quality assurance, and/or technical support.
  • Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 
  • Excellent communication, insatiable curiosity, and exceptional attention to detail.
  • Strong knowledge of Scrum theory, rules, and practices.
  • Must have hands-on experience with proposal creation and leading proposal presentations.
  • Knowledge of Agile techniques like User Stories, Continuous Integration, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Testing, Pairing, and Automated Testing.
  • Flexibility to travel.

EDUCATION 

Technical background with a bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Software, Project Management, or a related field is required. 

COMPENSATION

  • Competitive salary + Bonus
  • Training and Education Allowance
  • Remote, in-office, or Hybrid work
  • PTO + Holidays
  • Matching 401k
  • Health benefits – Medical, Dental & Vision

LOCATION

Our offices are headquartered in Houston, TX. 

We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time. Candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

job.title: Lead OneStream Delivery Consultant
job.description:
Are you ready to join a team of exceptionally talented technologists and work on exciting, career defining projects? 

At VeloMax, youâ€™ll deliver meaningful technology solutions to the Worldâ€™s most recognized brands and Fortune 500 companies. You will do this using the most sophisticated technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the worldâ€™s leading performance management vendors.

As a small specialized software development firm â€“ you will be given the unique opportunity to provide strategic support to the growth of our company. We offer endless career advancement opportunities and a clear growth path in a fun, stimulating environment.

JOB SUMMARY

The Lead OneStream Delivery Consultant is expected to have hands-on experience in two or more technologies within the OneStream Software solutions deck and be responsible for helping lead the design, development, and delivery of global, cutting-edge financial systems for our clients. 

Lead Consultants should possess knowledge of GAAP and IFRS, financial statements, as well as, strong functional knowledge around financial systems and processes.

The Lead Consultant will provide best-fit architectural solutions for one or more projects; you will assist in defining the scope, system requirements, and sizing of work. You will develop proof of concepts, provide solutions for the business problem, integrate platforms using third-party services, and design and develop complex features for clients' complex business needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Help clients prepare to make the transition to the OneStream Software platform by analyzing business operations, documenting requirements, and detailing design options. 
  • Provide solution architectural assessments, design strategies, and development roadmaps within a particular specialty area (integration, model build, marketplace planning, user experience, etc.)
  • Perform complex data validations, resolve data variance and business rule issues, and ensure compliance, design, and process improvements for consolidation software.
  • Ability to work closely and communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders including development teams, DBA's, SA, etc.
  • Build long-lasting partnerships with our clients and deliver unmatched expertise.

QUALIFICATIONS 

  • Minimum 2+ years of hands-on OneStream implementation experience.
  • Solid understanding of delivery methodology and experience leading teams in the implementation of the solution according to the design/architecture.
  • Solid reputation within the OneStream community for successful implementation and configuration skills
  • Minimum 2+ years of professional experience with Planning, Financial Close & Consolidation, Account Reconciliation, or other CPM applications.
  • Minimum 6+ years of professional experience with Oracle EPM/Hyperion Solutions with expertise in Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Essbase, or similar CPM solutions
  • Minimum 2+ years of accounting or finance experience.
  • Solid understanding of Financial Close Consolidation and planning process.
  • Strong understanding of metadata concepts (i.e. Cubes, hierarchies, dimensions).
  • Ability to demonstrate the use of Workflow, Cube Views, Dashboards, and Security.
  • Experience with data transformation tools, interfaces, integrations, reporting, and customizations.

EDUCATION

Bachelor's degree in Financial Accounting, MBA or CPA preferred. OneStream Software certification is preferred. 

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary + Bonus
  • Training and Education Allowance
  • Remote, in-office, or Hybrid work
  • PTO + Holidays
  • Matching 401k
  • Health benefits â€“ Medical, Dental & Vision

 

LOCATION

Our offices are headquartered in Houston, TX. Remote candidates (US only) will be considered. 

We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time. Candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
job.description:
Do you enjoy building elegant applications in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive, and rapidly scaling environment?

We are seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer who is passionate about marrying data with emerging technologies. As a VeloMax Software Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the World’s Most Recognized Brands and be at the forefront of driving a major transformation.

JOB SUMMARY

You will work with and across agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support the technical solutions using full-stack development tools and technologies.

The qualified engineer will join a team of talented developers and architects to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges and enhance business performance with data-based insights.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years of developing backend software in an enterprise team environment.
  • 3+ years experience in JavaScript, TypeScript, or other associated frameworks.
  • 3+ years of hands-on database experience: NoSQL, SQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, etc.
  • Strong experience in Python and Angular is a plus.
  • Experience in building RESTful web services.
  • Proven record of creating maintainable, clear, and well-structured code.
  • Solid software design principles that meet architectural standards.
  • Passion for learning new technology and building highly scalable solutions.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and be a strong team player.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship

*Each qualified applicant will be required to demonstrate program knowledge and complete skills testing interview.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary
  • Internal and external training
  • PTO
  • Matching 401k
  • Health benefits – Medical, Dental & Vision

LOCATION

Houston, TX

We are unable to offer sponsorship. Candidates MUST be authorized to work for any employer in the USA.
